title_review: Look hard to find this restaurant
review_preview: You will not be sorry when you follow the trip advisor 'Point me there" feature on their appl - we got close enough to ask the exact location - 50 yards away. We walked in without a reservation and were greeted and treat as though...
review_full: You will not be sorry when you follow the trip advisor 'Point me there" feature on their appl - we got close enough to ask the exact location - 50 yards away. We walked in without a reservation and were greeted and treat as though we had. The owner was very pleasant and helpful. The Menu de Dia was just flat out SUPERB. Forgot to take a picture of the salad because it was so well presented and also tasted great - simply a small head of Bibb lettuce cut into quarters with goat cheese, nuts and a delicate balsamic dressing. My wife had the salmorejo which was similarly delicate and quite fine. Entrees were a Turkish style ground filet and a superb hake. The desserts were also quite nice. It is small - 7-8 tables and intimate.  Walk around, get lost, ask directions but find this restaurant. Clearly one of the best meals of our trip to Madrid and other parts of Spain

review_preview: I went in the afternoon, for a long and lazy final meal before leaving Madrid. This cafe is friendly and trendy and not too large. It can take groups, solo travellers and couples. I first ordered their octopus, a recommended dish. It was outstanding. The...
review_full: I went in the afternoon, for a long and lazy final meal before leaving Madrid. This cafe is friendly and trendy and not too large. It can take groups, solo travellers and couples. I first ordered their octopus, a recommended dish. It was outstanding. The waiter kindly recommended a glass of white wine as I was dining alone, but a more varied wine list was available. I had ravioli (made in-house) after that, and it was also delightful. I finished with chocolate cake and coffee. The meal was so good, I am already planning to return in future. I stayed for nearly three hours and was allowed to eat in peace with attentive, lovely service. The restaurant is near Atocha, and the Prado, on a beautiful and quiet street. This restaurant cannot be recommended highly enough.

review_preview: We visited this restaurant on the strength of other reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The restaurant is tucked away down a little street away from the madding crowds of Madrid. It is small and cosy but has a lovely atmosphere, lovely staff....
review_full: We visited this restaurant on the strength of other reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The restaurant is tucked away down a little street away from the madding crowds of Madrid. It is small and cosy but has a lovely atmosphere, lovely staff. We had three dishes, a full salad and half portions of the tapas. It was very nice food and more than enough for two of us. With a couple of beers the bill came to around 25 euros which for a good meal in Madrid was not too bad. Some of the reviews recommended going early which we did, around 8pm, however the place was quite busy at this time so something to bear in mind. Would come back to Taberna el Sur if ever in Madrid again.

review_preview: We searched for a restaurant to enjoy paella in Madrid and came across this gem within a reasonable walk from the Prado Museum. We were warmly greeted and received great recommendations for starters for our meal. The beer was cold, the roasted vegetables and goat...
review_full: We searched for a restaurant to enjoy paella in Madrid and came across this gem within a reasonable walk from the Prado Museum. We were warmly greeted and received great recommendations for starters for our meal. The beer was cold, the roasted vegetables and goat cheese were well seasoned and tasty and the star of the show, the paella, did not disappoint. Plenty of seafood, and perfectly prepared.  The after dinner liqueurs and chocolate cake brought to our table was a great surprise and this generous gesture from the staff was a perfect end to our final day in Madrid. If you find yourself in Madrid it would be a mistake to not make a stop here!

title_review: Very friendly staff and good food
review_preview: During my 1 week trip in Madrid, I visited El Sur twice just because everything seemed right and I had a good time there. The owner Johnny is the best so are his staff. They are warm and friendly by nature. It's like you went...
review_full: During my 1 week trip in Madrid, I visited El Sur twice just because everything seemed right and I had a good time there. The owner Johnny is the best so are his staff. They are warm and friendly by nature. It's like you went to a friend's place for food.  The first time I visited on a Friday afternoon. They offered weekday lunch menu which is 3 courses with a drink, for 10 Euros only! They change the daily menu everyday so basically you could go there everyday:) The food was good and the drink: sangria without alcohol was phenomenal! The second time I visited was Saturday afternoon. They didn't offer lunch menu anymore but it's still affordable. I ordered the black paella and it is very very good. I was so happy that I came back.  Overall it's a nice experience and the staffs are the best! I will come back when I visited Madrid again.

review_preview: Much like Tarantino’s hit film, this restaurant comes highly regarded by those who appreciate true quality.Expecting just another Spanish tapas bar to be much like the others, Taberna más al sur stands above the rest. 5 minutes off the beaten track and away from...
review_full: Much like Tarantino’s hit film, this restaurant comes highly regarded by those who appreciate true quality. Expecting just another Spanish tapas bar to be much like the others, Taberna más al sur stands above the rest. 5 minutes off the beaten track and away from heaving tourist areas this quaint hidden gem is full of life. We were greeted by the charming Jon, Edu and Matias who made us feel like part of the local community. The food arrived swiftly and we ate it even faster! Delicious does not do justice to delights of Spanish cuisine to which we were introduced. The in-house sangria lovingly crafted by the caballeros behind the bar is quite possibly the finest thing I have ever had and I can confidently say, having lived in Andalucía for 6 months in the past, that it puts the rest of Spain to shame! Cannot recommend enough!

title_review: What a surprise!! Excellent meal and excellent price
review_preview: I went I this restaurant for lunch based on the Tripadvisor reviews and what a positive surprise!! The place is quite small (9 tables only), so booking is advised. I had the set menu and it was so tasty. The set menu gives you two...
review_full: I went I this restaurant for lunch based on the Tripadvisor reviews and what a positive surprise!! The place is quite small (9 tables only), so booking is advised. I had the set menu and it was so tasty. The set menu gives you two courses, a glass of wine (or another drink), bread and coffee for €12,50, which is an excellent price for the quality of the food you have.  The service is excellent and fast. Everyone is very friendly. They also have WiFi.  Definitely a place to return!!

I had a delicious prawn and avacado salad with calamari pieces - the dressing was incredible. My main was pork fillet medallions and sweet sauce. We both had a big slice of pineapple for afters. An excellent meal costing 25 euros in total for 3 courses a diet coke and glass of wine. This is a very small restaurant at the top of a small street, but well worth finding! It is ideally located for any of the major tourist traps of the Retiro Park, Prado Museum etc.

review_preview: We actually went to the "original" Taberna El Sure, but it was too crowded and had 45 mins wait. We can see why because it is very small. The manager/owner greeted us and said he has another restaurant with the same food and it's not...
review_full: We actually went to the "original" Taberna El Sure, but it was too crowded and had 45 mins wait. We can see why because it is very small. The manager/owner greeted us and said he has another restaurant with the same food and it's not far. He asked a girl to show us. We were served by William. What a great guy! He used his limited English and we used our limited Espanol, but because I already looked through via TripAdvisor and Google reviews...it was a lot easier to decide. When our orders came out. Wow...I mean wow! Chipirones, musaka, Gambones, risotto, Vieja (Cuban pulled pork)...it was impressively good for an alley restaurant!  When comes to Spanish tapas, I would highly recommend medios (half or small) orders and everyone can share and get a taste of many different dishes. I would avoid ordering large portions and do the Americano style of single order for yourself. We were already pretty stuffed and had a great smile after those great dishes. I wish I had room for Pulpo (octopus). William asked if we had room for desert, and after letting him know we would decline, he decided to give us a shot of "Bailey" type Irish coffee drink and a shot of cranberry refresher for my daughter. Great guy, friendly, service with a smile. He really put icing on our day after our hot one day trip to Toledo! All this only came to 31.60 Euro. We were shocked, because this type of food and service would cost us around $70 in the San Francisco BayArea!

title_review: Best food and service in Madrid!
review_preview: Taberna el sur was the best dining experience we had while on an extended stay in Madrid. Service in Madrid is normally very relaxed and you wait for almost everything, but our server Alex was quick to check in on any of our needs.The...
review_full: Taberna el sur was the best dining experience we had while on an extended stay in Madrid. Service in Madrid is normally very relaxed and you wait for almost everything, but our server Alex was quick to check in on any of our needs. The food was incredible! After trying tapas restaurant after tapas restaurant we learned to not expect too much, but our opinions were completely changed after this meal. Try the musaka! We ended up ordering another serving. The pork with porto sauce dish and chicken curry were excellent as well. Alex even threw in a round of shots to complete our dinner... So charming and personable! The restaurant is small and was busy when we left, so come early or try to make reservations. Prices were affordable which means we will definetely return.

title_review: A small gem hidden in Madrid
review_preview: Its a tiny bistro and, I have to say, Its a nice surprise: their dishes are very creative, presence of fresh and high quality ingredients> fish, poultry, mushrooms and vegetables.I took a warm salad with mushrooms, fantastic, and as a main course, chicken.The...
review_full: Its a tiny bistro and, I have to say, Its a nice surprise: their dishes are very creative, presence of fresh and high quality ingredients> fish, poultry, mushrooms and vegetables. I took a warm salad with mushrooms, fantastic, and as a main course, chicken. The fish in papillotte was great too. The owner is between the tables, always asking you about the service. The only con, is that, at the time they informed us that the credit card payment was unavailable due to problems with their postnet, we've already asked for the first plate. I recommend this restaurant, specially if you want to get rid, for a moment, of the typical spanish meson menu, with eggs, oil, potatoes, tapas and so on. Nice fusion trendy food.

review_preview: Agree with previous reviews that they chef tried to combine some interesting flavors together. You may or may not like it depending on our individual taste. For example, we had beef stew with honey and burger "From Russia to Turkey". Its innovative but the best...
review_full: Agree with previous reviews that they chef tried to combine some interesting flavors together. You may or may not like it depending on our individual taste. For example, we had beef stew with honey and burger "From Russia to Turkey". Its innovative but the best word to describe the taste of both dishes is "interesting".  What really stood out was the service. The menu is an ipad with multilingual support. We compared both the Chinese and English translations before ordering. In English, it said fillet, and in Chinese, it said fish. So I thought I ordered the fish fillet. You can imagine my surprise when I was served a beef hamburger. We decide to keep it but the owner noticed our surprise and brought a fish dish. We didn't take it because we were full. But the gesture was greatly appreciated. This was the best meal we had a in Madrid and would recommend it!

Perfect lunch for a hot day walking around in Madrid. The staff were nothing short of courteous and kind - especially David. Perfect lunch for my first day in Madrid!!

review_preview: After studying in Barcelona for 3 months, I decided to travel to Madrid with my mom for a couple of days. I looked up restaurants and found this place, which was already highly rated. Taberna el Sur did not disappoint. It’s a cute little restaurant...
review_full: After studying in Barcelona for 3 months, I decided to travel to Madrid with my mom for a couple of days. I looked up restaurants and found this place, which was already highly rated.  Taberna el Sur did not disappoint. It’s a cute little restaurant in a narrow street close to the city center. The decorations created a cozy and authentic feel. The classical music playing created a calm and intimate atmosphere. Next comes the food, which was amazing and some of the best Spanish food I’ve had. I ordered a beef sirloin with goat cheese and a baby squids as an appetizer and both were amazing.  My server Jhoan was extremely friendly and provided fantastic service. I don’t usually leave reviews for restaurants I’ve been to but felt that this place definitely deserved one. This one’s worth checking out!

We had peppers wrapped in ham with a mustard and balsamic sauce that was amazing. We had an excellent arugula salad and fried provolone. Entrees were an Argentine steak (on the plancha) and filet mignon. FYI... if you like your steaks medium rare in the US, that's a medium in Spain. Everything was beautifully plated. Dessert was their take on a cheesecake. very light and tasty. A wonderful evening. Will probably be back for more!

So the owner reserved a table for us and offered wine and dessert on the house for waiting about 35-40 minutes until he opened the restaurant. We had the fixed dinner menu for 25 EUR/p, it was one of the best meals we've had in a restaurant. The owner and the staff were very nice, describing all meals and asking if everything is fine. The restaurant has at most 8 tables, making the place cosy, with a nice atmosphere. Will definitely go again when we'll be in Madrid the next time.

They offer crisps (emphasis on CRISP) with a select few of their entrees that are definitely worth eating. Another significant standout was the fact that they offered fresh, delicious salads. We had the white wine sangria, moussaka as an appetizer, the ropa vieja, the el sur salad and the beetroot cake (also known as red velvet cake) for desert. Everything was great, the service was wonderful and they gave us a complimentary shot after our meal which consisted of mint and hibiscus (we think) which was nice and refreshing- overall, great experience.

title_review: Tasty tapas and dinner in Lavapies neighborhood
review_preview: Based on other reviews from TripAdvisor, I decided to bring my family here for dinner.  I called for a reservation the same night and they were very accommodating - telling me to let them know 5 minutes before I get there.  We ended up early,...
review_full: Based on other reviews from TripAdvisor, I decided to bring my family here for dinner. I called for a reservation the same night and they were very accommodating - telling me to let them know 5 minutes before I get there. We ended up early, so we had a 10 minute wait. It is a small, busy restaurant with more seating toward the back where you cannot see. There is no street seating. The service was very attentive, but a few large families were there the same time as my family of 5. It meant we had one item missed (eggplant - and I forgot to check the bill - it was charged). On the plus side, the food is very tasty. For Madrid, it is also very reasonably priced. We went with the Cuban Ropa Vieja which was good, the recommended curry chicken which was fantastic, chiparones (small squid) - again excellent, and a vegetable eggplant dish. The half portions were ample to feed the 5 of us. I had a glass of wine while my wife enjoyed a margarita. At the end of the meal, I had a Pedro Ximenez which they comped. If you want a tasty, simple, no frills dinner in Madrid, you cannot go wrong with Taberna Al Sur. The staff will treat you well and the food was very good.

review_preview: I can't begin to express how happy we were to have found this restaurant. We made a reservation long before our trip and were so happy we did. This is a great little restaurant with the most amazing service and food. It was our favorite...
review_full: I can't begin to express how happy we were to have found this restaurant. We made a reservation long before our trip and were so happy we did. This is a great little restaurant with the most amazing service and food. It was our favorite meal in Spain and maybe one of my most favorite of anywhere I've been.  It does not open until 9 pm and if you go even a little before it will be closed up and dark but don't worry they will be open right at 9 and will welcome you with open arms. We ordered a couple of small plates to start and were given a complimentary tasting which turned out to be one of the small plates we had already ordered. When they realized that we had actually ordered that item, they brought out another complimentary dish for us to try.  For our main courses we both ordered the risotto. I had the mushroom truffle risotto and my mother had the beef and pepper risotto. Both of them were so good and we both are still talking about our meal to this day!  I also could not believe how inexpensive our meal was! We had so much food plus dessert and wine and when we got the bill I did a double take because it was so low. I had just had a similar meal in Chicago and paid about 3 times as much. With all of that being said about the food, the service is even better. We were so welcomed by everyone there. We do not speak Spanish and that did not matter at all. Everyone spoke English and made sure we were taken care of throughout the evening.  If you go to Madrid you need to go to this restaurant. Our trip was very short so we didn't get to go back but we would definitely have tried. We are already trying to figure out when we can go back just so we can eat that risotto!

review_preview: My boyf and I visited on a recent Saturday night after having a drink in the area and doing a quick Trip Advisor search to find somewhere close by to eat that evening. We were not disappointed!Lovely small establishment - cosy but not cramped...
review_full: My boyf and I visited on a recent Saturday night after having a drink in the area and doing a quick Trip Advisor search to find somewhere close by to eat that evening. We were not disappointed! Lovely small establishment - cosy but not cramped and with a good buzz. We managed to beat the rush and were seated at about 7.45pm. Staff were excellent - friendly and genuinely happy to help with recommending dishes and translating into English when required. I chose one of the specials and it was the best meal I had during my stay in Madrid - superbly flavoursome steak with roquefort sauce. My partner had a fish special and said it was divine. The place was busy but we didn't feel rushed at any point. We liked the place so much it didn't take much convincing to stay for pudding, especially after having seen some amazing looking cakes on display as we arrived! I had a HUGE slice of banana cake. Usually I find cakes in mnay restaurants either look good or taste good - but this one ticked both boxes and to my delight was served in a ridiculously generous portion (although I wouldn't have left a crumb!). My boyf loved the homemade berry cheesecake. And the icing on the banana cake was.....the cost for our food and two beers was a piddlingly small amount - something like 30 euros which for the quality and experience was amazing. Really excellent. If we come to Madrid again we'll be back! And I'll have the beetroot cake next time! :-D

This was a welcome change from some of the dour service we had in Barcelona.  We had a few of the recommendations such as the salmorejo, musaka (lasagna like dish) , chicken curry, solomillo sur (filet mignon in grape sauce) and topped it off with a jug of sangria. At the end of the meal, we were given complimentary shots of their home made digestifs that tasted like Bailey's Irish Cream (but better). Really enjoyed our meal in this comfortable, local tapas joint.

review_preview: The Tragantua is a small restaurant located in the center of Madrid, very near to different museums as Prado and Reina Sofia. The place is a little bit narrow but still comfortable. The waiter and waitress make you feel at home. If we have to...
review_full: The Tragantua is a small restaurant located in the center of Madrid, very near to different museums as Prado and Reina Sofia. The place is a little bit narrow but still comfortable. The waiter and waitress make you feel at home. If we have to talk about the food, which really matter, the Tragantua has the one of the best daily menus in all Madrid. The variety, quality and quantity of the menu are more than perfect for its price (12,50€), including a drink and a dessert. The menu combines traditional recipes with creative touches and dishes with international styles. It is advisable to book before going. I will not hesitate to suggest this place to anyone.

title_review: A Tip Regarding Location of this Excellent Restaurant
review_preview: We chose this intimate restaurant based on TripAdvisor reviews and, like others, enjoyed one of the most memorable meals of our trip to Spain.  We easily made an online reservation and were treated to excellent food and warm service at a reasonable price.  Others have...
review_full: We chose this intimate restaurant based on TripAdvisor reviews and, like others, enjoyed one of the most memorable meals of our trip to Spain. We easily made an online reservation and were treated to excellent food and warm service at a reasonable price. Others have noted that La Tragantua can be difficult to find and is not in the precise location shown on the linked map. Please note that it is located on the south side of Calle Veronica about one building in from the intersection with Calle Fucar. It's best to approach from Calle Fucar, as Calle Veronica is an unattractive street, more like an alley. The map erroneously shows it closer to Calle Alameda than to Calle Fucar. I hope this helps others find this tiny gem.

Service was prompt and friendly. Some English spoken, but you'll need to have access to a translator app on your smart phone. Menu is quite varied with something for most, and food was well prepared. Madrid was extremely hot when we visited and the air conditioning in the restaurant seemed rather stressed. All in all a pleasant dining experience though.

title_review: Delightful Find near the Reina Sophia

The place was packed, and I managed to snag a seat at the last table. This is a little gem of a restaurant, maybe 12-14 tables in all. The staff were wonderful, the food was very good and the price was excellent (I did the prix fixe lunch for 14 euros). It was a happy chance that I ran across it, and that the folks in front of me decided to go elsewhere!

The three course menu for the day at €15.50 per person...which includes a drink - was well worth it. The entrees are amazing. Have the pepper wrapped in ham and the goats cheese salad. The wok style rice is really good too. Finish off with a cheesecake and a cortado. The chef even popped out to greet the guests -- speaking both in Spanish and English.

title_review: A fantastic experience with first-rate service!
review_preview: First off, reserve a table. We saw many people turned away from this tiny place. And it's worth the reservation! The prices are very reasonable -- especially for the lunch menu -- and the food is great. I'd suggest trying the mushroom appetizer and the...
review_full: First off, reserve a table. We saw many people turned away from this tiny place. And it's worth the reservation! The prices are very reasonable -- especially for the lunch menu -- and the food is great. I'd suggest trying the mushroom appetizer and the shrimp & eel risotto. The real perk of this restaurant is the service. The owner takes the time to greet everyone personally (even if you're just waiting outside the door) and explain the menu. He's friendly, warm and genuine, someone who obviously cares that you have the best experience you can. We loved this place enough to visit it twice on a three-day trip.

review_preview: We stumbled upon this restaurant after a day at the Prado, when we checked yelp for restaurants nearby and found one with a much higher rating than anything around it.  The menu is available online, and enticed us from the start, but it's nothing to...
review_full: We stumbled upon this restaurant after a day at the Prado, when we checked yelp for restaurants nearby and found one with a much higher rating than anything around it. The menu is available online, and enticed us from the start, but it's nothing to the presentation and flavor. The restaurant is quite small, but stylish and modern. Service is very good, and the owner comes around to each table. But the true star of the evening is the food.  The flavors come together wonderfully, and the presentation is beautiful. Every dish was incredibly delicious. On our dinner visit we had the apple and goat cheese salad and the shrimp and calamari skewers to start, and the beef risotto and pork with vegetables for entrees, and every bite was to die for. I can't recommend the food enough! In fact, this as the only restaurant we ate at twice on our trip, returning for lunch on our last day. They have a menu of the day for lunch with bread, drink, starter, entree, and dessert for 12.5€. Everything was exactly as delicious as dinner, and the best deal we got this whole trip. Reservations are recommended for dinner, they only have 9 tables and you don't want to miss out on this experience. I cannot rave enough about this fantastic restaurant!

review_preview: My husband and I dined here on our first night in Madrid after a day of sight seeing and tapas hopping. We saw the reviews and stopped by to see if we could get s table sans reservation. Luckily for us, a 9pm table didn't...
review_full: My husband and I dined here on our first night in Madrid after a day of sight seeing and tapas hopping. We saw the reviews and stopped by to see if we could get s table sans reservation. Luckily for us, a 9pm table didn't show. We were sat and greeted at 9:30. From the get-go, service was top notch. Well beyond our American standards. My husband has a shellfish allergy, so any time we travel, we take extra precaution. The staff made us feel confident this was a non-issue and we were immediately at ease. The bottle of tasty Garnacha helped.  We enjoyed some very tasty items, including foie gras with cranberry sauce, tuna sashimi and hake. All prepared to perfection. The desert was outstanding, a mango mascarpone crème special. Unreal.  Totally worth checking out and making a rezzie. Enjoy!

The calamari starter was delicious but had a (light, white/blonde hair sticking out from one of the rings) being my husband tried so hard to find this pace to please me, I said nothing and just didn't eat that one. The bread basket looked inviting but sadly cold and stale :( this is such a basic that I think I was more disappointed with that the the whole meal. The wine was good. All in all I think the reviews are a bit hiked up and if I want to give them the benefit of the doubt, maybe the chef was having a bad day. I won't return in a hurry.

title_review: Wonderful service and even better food
review_preview: We called to make sure we could get seats for the lunch special and after getting the okay, arrived about 15 minutes later. The lunch special is a great value, about 14 euros for a drink, 2 courses, and dessert or coffee. I opted for...
review_full: We called to make sure we could get seats for the lunch special and after getting the okay, arrived about 15 minutes later. The lunch special is a great value, about 14 euros for a drink, 2 courses, and dessert or coffee. I opted for pasta in a creamy tomato sauce that was absolutely divine. My second course was hake, which was also good. My husband had the vegetable wok, which I sampled and was delicious. Between the pasta and wok, I can't decide which was better. For dessert, we had the flan and hazelnut ice cream. The flan was good, just like any other flan. The ice cream was thick and creamy. No complaints there. As for the service, it was also impeccable. Our plates were cleared off the table almost immediately after we finished each course, and were replaced with the next. I'm not sure if she was the manager, and I feel awful for forgetting her name, but the short-haired woman running the whole show that day was very kind and checked on us to make sure everything was running smoothly. Highly recommended and would definitely go back.

review_full: What can I say to this restaurant? What also can I say about Pablo the owner? Initially we planned to have dinner in a local and traditional Spanish restaurant. Searching on trip advisor we found a rest 2 blocks from La Tragantua that was full. Asking the waiter a recommendation he gave us not only this, he was guiding us to one of most amazing restaurant experience of me and my wife.  Let me explain. As we walked in Pablo the owner hosted us like a friend. Ask to wait 5 minutes because it was full the rest, they have 7 tables. Three minutes later we were set up. The lovely waitresses also helped us with the understanding of the plates and suggestion of wine.  We had a bottle of amazing wine Coto de Hayas and an amazing blue cheese as entree. Main course unbelievable, mushrooms risotto trufado and octopus with potato and guacamole. Ohhh gosh I can't explain how good are those plates.  The environment is really relaxing.  Excellent choose for every time in Madrid for sure!!!

title_review: Stop for the aroma, stay for the meat
review_preview: Located on the ninth floor of el Corte Ingles, this is an Eataly like experience called the Gourmet Experience with an entire floor dedicated to wine, olive oil, meat, and a world-wide diversity of food (sushi bar sits next to tapas). Camino Sacramento is grilling...
review_full: Located on the ninth floor of el Corte Ingles, this is an Eataly like experience called the Gourmet Experience with an entire floor dedicated to wine, olive oil, meat, and a world-wide diversity of food (sushi bar sits next to tapas). Camino Sacramento is grilling their meat on an open flame and whatever the cuts of the day are which are presented, are perfectly seasoned and salted. Meat choices change depending on what is brought in. The atmosphere is that of an indoor street with people strolling by with packages and wine glasses. The area to sit is crowded with seats and tables for perhaps 25-30, elbow to elbow. Don't expect a table cloth experience or quiet dining.  Food is served on a metal cookie sheet with boiled potatoes or a finely chopped slaw and a few slices of toasted baguette. But every bite is so good! Christina served us, she brought the meat to the table to explain the cuts and flavor and took our order. It was late and she served the entire restaurant, but we noticed that she treated every single table as though they were the first of the evening. She speaks English well. Wine selection is limited.

title_review: One of our favorite places in Madrid
review_preview: We ate here in November, 2017, and looked forward to returning. We were not disappointed! This place is small, it sits 22 at a few tables and maybe 4 at bar stools. A reservation during peak Spanish eating hours is advised. The chef comes up...
review_full: We ate here in November, 2017, and looked forward to returning. We were not disappointed! This place is small, it sits 22 at a few tables and maybe 4 at bar stools. A reservation during peak Spanish eating hours is advised. The chef comes up with some very interesting combinations, both in meat/seafood category and in vegetarian choices. We had a shiitake mushroom dish with black garlic under an lid of baked egg white merengue beaten with honey. Totally delicious. I ran right out and bought some black garlic to take back to USA! The service is causal in a very friendly manner, with English spoken, but this place isn't visited much by tourists due to its location off the beaten track. It little on the expensive side for mid range, but not too bad. With wine one filling 3 course lunch with wine was 52 Euros and the other was 68 Euros

The lunch menu was very affordable but plenty of food. I had a pumpkin soup that was smooth and yummy and my wife had a veggie Korean wok pasta dish that was perfectly spiced. Our main course was Turkish hamburgers (excellent) and a wild mushroom risotto (outrageous). Dessert was this tiny custard in a cake cup soaked in honey. I've never had anything like it. And cafe con leche of course. Overall, great food, tiny cozy place. Loved it!

title_review: Not bad, not great Taco Bar
review_preview: We, two persons, visited Mawey Taco Bar during our vacation in Madrid with lots of taco bars to chose from in Madrid mainly because its great reviews. We had no reservations, but it was no problem to get a table. The interior is a modern...
review_full: We, two persons, visited Mawey Taco Bar during our vacation in Madrid with lots of taco bars to chose from in Madrid mainly because its great reviews. We had no reservations, but it was no problem to get a table. The interior is a modern setting which feels a bit artificial and the seats were a bit uncomfortable. Service was friendly and all in all good. Lacking English skills made communication interesting, but were no obstacle. We chose various tacos, which arrived after one another at the table. Some of the tacos did not quite hit our taste, but as that is individual taste, we do not fault anybody for that as the craftsmanship was fine. The portions were very small however, also for conceived satiety dishes which really were needed due to the general small portion size. In our opinion, the pricing did not fit the portion size and the setting and was way to expensive. All in all we were a bit disappointed due to our high expectations. The visit was not bad, but also not great. We would try another taco bar next time in Madrid.

title_review: Small Place, Small Plates, Big Flavor
review_preview: This small place in the museum section of Madrid is a real diamond in the rough.  It has the feel of a neighborhood place that's mainly frequented by locals.  Dinner isn't served until late (9 pm) as is the custom of Spanish places.  As you...
review_full: This small place in the museum section of Madrid is a real diamond in the rough. It has the feel of a neighborhood place that's mainly frequented by locals. Dinner isn't served until late (9 pm) as is the custom of Spanish places. As you enter, there's a small bar area usually frequented by hipsters meeting up after work. To the rear there's a small dining room, simply decorated with a handful of tables. It wasn't very crowded on a weekday evening. Service was friendly and efficient. Both waitstaff spoke good English and English menus are available. I asked for the house vino tinto and was served a very good rioja. The authentic Spanish cuisine menu was split between small plate appetizers and larger main courses. I tried a variety of dishes, all were excellently prepared but the highlight was the leeks and cheese quiche-- an amazing dish. I also enjoyed a dish of broad beans, egg & ham. I highly recommend this place and will return when in Madrid.

review_preview: This small restaurant tucked away in the quiet leafy neighbourhood of Jeronimos  (between the Retiro park and Thyssen Museum) will give you a bit of everything that is great about Madrid.  The owners/ managers/ brothers Gonzalo & Angel are wonderful hosts and you are guaranteed...
review_full: This small restaurant tucked away in the quiet leafy neighbourhood of Jeronimos (between the Retiro park and Thyssen Museum) will give you a bit of everything that is great about Madrid. The owners/ managers/ brothers Gonzalo & Angel are wonderful hosts and you are guaranteed a warm welcome. The menu is simple, unpretentious and covers the whole of Spain; it also includes few international dishes - although the main focus is Madrid and northern Spanish cuisine. Last but not least, the crowd that hang out there are very entertaining.

You could just as easily end up having a quiet romantic dinner or end up meeting a bunch of new friends!

title_review: Wonderful Bistro in neighborhood of Los Jeronimos
review_preview: A wonderful little bistro tucked away in a very elegant neighbourhood called Los Jeronimos between the Prado and the Retiro Park.  The neighbourhood is a little oasis within the city filled with trees and lovely buildings.  Adrede offers a warm and inviting setting with typical...
review_full: A wonderful little bistro tucked away in a very elegant neighbourhood called Los Jeronimos between the Prado and the Retiro Park. The neighbourhood is a little oasis within the city filled with trees and lovely buildings. Adrede offers a warm and inviting setting with typical Spanish dishes reminding me of Spanish home cooking. The Salmorejo was divine and the pastel of leek was mouth watering. The service is really good and overall, this is a great place to consider for lunch or dinner while in Madrid. There is something on the menu for everyone including a diversity of vegetable dishes. It is clear the chef takes great care in his dishes adding a new modern touch to the classics of Spain but not at an expensive price. Very reasonable prices. I would recommend this place highly.

review_preview: We adored Adrede and had a truly excellent meal there! It was located perfectly for us - between the Prado and El Retiro, just right for a post-museum lunch before siesta in the park. It’s in a quiet residential area which meant that it wasn’t...
review_full: We adored Adrede and had a truly excellent meal there! It was located perfectly for us - between the Prado and El Retiro, just right for a post-museum lunch before siesta in the park. It’s in a quiet residential area which meant that it wasn’t swarmed with tourists, and seemed like a popular place for locals. We ordered a lot of things and were happy with all of them - delicious gazpacho, a very light and fluffy leek quiche, some sausage with french fries that was indulgent and huge. Best of all, the service was unusually friendly and attentive - the guys running the place clearly care about creating a welcoming atmosphere and making sure we had everything we needed. Highly recommend!

title_review: What a lovely place - and a great crew
review_preview: Just round the corner from our hotel what a fantastic place to begin your first weekend break in Madrid. From the meals provided by the brilliant chef Gonzalez to the impeccable service by the lovely Isabel the whole expeience was exceptional. Top that off with...
review_full: Just round the corner from our hotel what a fantastic place to begin your first weekend break in Madrid. From the meals provided by the brilliant chef Gonzalez to the impeccable service by the lovely Isabel the whole expeience was exceptional. Top that off with the welcome provided by Angel and Nadine - why would you want to go anywhere else? The Riberia wine was full of flavour and the ox cheeks to die for... although to pick out indivudual meals is unfair to the rest of the menu!! We will certainly remember our first visit to Madrid for both the friendly people and the warm atmosphere of the city typically brought together in this place and the crew who were unbelieveble. Thank You

review_full: We found out about this restaurant through trip advisor. We're glad we listened to the reviews and tried it for ourselves as it exceeded our expectations. Thirdly, just enjoy taking the time to enjoy a leisurely lunch along with the natives. This is an authentic Spanish restaurant, not a tourist spot. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. The food was cooked to perfection. The location was very close to our hotel, The Westin, and Retiro park and the three museums.

review_preview: I went there many times , as a local from Madrid to have some beers with tapas , or to eat dinner. It is the traditional restaurant in Spain: a bar , an area beside the bar to sit and drink, and another area which...
review_full: I went there many times , as a local from Madrid to have some beers with tapas , or to eat dinner. It is the traditional restaurant in Spain: a bar , an area beside the bar to sit and drink, and another area which is for lunch/dinner TAPAS: in the "bar" area .typical bar table, with oily and fat tapas, that's what we want. You can order the little beer or the doble beer. Normal prices. Bartender are "straigh to the point" professional, efficient and loud, which could sound a bit rough for foreigner, but it is totally normal in Spain, I appreciate that. I don't like poshy bartenders. DINNER / LUNCH with reservation: The lobster is taken alive from the aquarium at the entrance, so it is super fresh ! they are specialized in rices, they prepare the paella as soon as you order , something that needs to be taken into account in quality (many places warm rice again taken from a pot prepared earlier). My aunt and my mother were super happy. We had anchovies and tuna for starter, and then the speciality of the house lobster paella. We ordered coffee and dessert for three, and the restaurant gave us the shots of digestive alcool for free . Total price was 115 euros, which is not that much for three people. I never went there without reservation There is a guy there who speak many languages lately, so I guess he was hired to help with foreigners. CONCLUSION: I would say that you need to know how the spanish life is to appreciate it, but it general it is very good for my taste. Maybe the tapas are a little bit to fat haha (But when we go there to get drunk with friends after work it is even better )

title_review: Excellent meal and service, but beware of the charges
review_preview: We had a delicious meal here (paella con pollo and a pitcher of sangria) and I cannot fault the service--in fact the camarero was one of the friendliest we had in Madrid. But it is essential to read the menu very carefully when you order!...
review_full: We had a delicious meal here (paella con pollo and a pitcher of sangria) and I cannot fault the service--in fact the camarero was one of the friendliest we had in Madrid. But it is essential to read the menu very carefully when you order! If the menu specifies that a dish is for a "minimum of two people", this means that you will be charged 2x the listed price for it. So that 22-euro dish will end up costing the pair of you a cool 44 euros.  Also, we had assumed the bread and butter that appeared on our table (without our having ordered it) was complimentary, but we were charged four euros for it. (The butter was very good, though, and probably worth the extra charge--I think there was melted blue cheese in it.)

Not situated in the nicest area but it is safe if a wee bit scruffy.This is more a bar with a few tables than a restaurant. Nice people with limited English who try their best to explain the menu. Excellent selection of wines by the glass. My kids had burgers which were great, with the best french fries we've had in along time. I had a paella type dish which was nice and my wife had a caesar salad which was good but she did find a small piece of raw chicken which rather spoiled it a bit. I'd probably only recommend it if you really couldn't be bothered going into the centre as there are many better places on cava baja and around there.

review_preview: This place really is starting to come into its own.  Located in Embajadores, which is not anywhere close to the other "cool" neighborhoods of Madrid, this bar is following the "cool" trends of Madrid (micro brews, hamburgers, and sort of expensive wines), but doing it...
review_full: This place really is starting to come into its own. Located in Embajadores, which is not anywhere close to the other "cool" neighborhoods of Madrid, this bar is following the "cool" trends of Madrid (micro brews, hamburgers, and sort of expensive wines), but doing it in a more low key fashion, without the pretensions of trying to be too cool for school. We ordered the risotto with boletus and jamón de cordero, which was out of this world delicious and rather abundant. They didn't skimp, which happens all too often in many places that suddenly become popular like this one. The service can be a bit slow when the place is full (there are only 5 tables) because when I was there, there was only one of the owners (who are two brothers, thus the name) bartending and serving the tables. If you live in Madrid, I would recommend checking this place out soon because in two or three months it may be already way "cool." I hope not!

It wasn't busy - plenty of room at that time on a Wednesday evening but if they keep getting these great reviews, they will fill up. Well worth the visit when visiting Madrid. If you don't speak much Spanish, then visit the menu on Yelp so you can plan ahead unless you are an adventurer like me and I found out what I ate after the fact. :)

Next time we travel to Madrid we will make sure to spend an evening having dinner here!

review_full: Excellent find. Bernardo was so welcoming and gave the best service we experienced during six days in Madrid. The restaurant was not busy which was impossible to believe. Bernardo and his colleagues presented the meal to us with great pride and this pride was totally justified. The total experience was one for which you would expect to spend a great deal more. A word of warning - don't be put off by the appearance outside. The photos of the food outside the door do the food inside no justice at all. It is immeasurably superior. Loved it.

review_preview: After searching from a lot of different sources the best paella in the city, we heard about this little place, which we thought wouldn't meet our expectations as many recommended restaurants had done before that. And although at first it didn't look like much and...
review_full: After searching from a lot of different sources the best paella in the city, we heard about this little place, which we thought wouldn't meet our expectations as many recommended restaurants had done before that. And although at first it didn't look like much and was completely empty(!), we were proven wrong. The service was top notch, the waiters very friendly and welcoming, the food absolutely delicious from the starters to the main dish (which was a huge portion of paella that we devoured) and the prices fair. Overall the atmosphere and the choice of music (spanish romantic songs) was pleasant and well suited and it boggles my mind how it was completely empty. You should definitely check it out if you want an authentic spanish food experience.

Took about ninety minutes from arriving to get through to burger delivery which isn't great for fast food. When the burgers arrived the meat was great but the bun and relish less interesting and not in line with pricing- not much of it and quite standard, including cold fries.  Did like their ?6 cocktails though, good value if slowly delivered!

title_review: This is how burgers should be
review_preview: I try to maintain a bell curve in my ratings here on Trip Advisor; most of my ratings are 2, 3 or 4 points out of 5. So when I give a place a 5 in my review, which is not often, it means it...
review_full: I try to maintain a bell curve in my ratings here on Trip Advisor; most of my ratings are 2, 3 or 4 points out of 5. So when I give a place a 5 in my review, which is not often, it means it is exceptional. Steakburger is one of those rare ones. I visited the Luchana branch as I was staying in the area. It's not the most touristy part of Madrid, but if you are staying elsewhere in the city, it's easy to get here since the restaurant is only about 200 metres northeast of Bilbao metro station. I chose the "Jack Burger", which came with lettuce, tomato, Monterrey Jack cheese, bacon, and a special Bourbon sauce. The sauce was slightly sweetish and complemented the other ingredients wonderfully. The burgers come in 4 size options: 160g, 250g, 350g and an even bigger one. They even ask how you want the meat done: I asked for "medium well" and it came out absolutely perfect, with crispy bacon on top. Here's the interesting thing. You can order a "ternera" (beef) or "buey" (ox) patty. Buey costs about 20% more then ternera. So I ordered ox, just to give it a try. I don't think I can tell the difference. This is not the only place that makes this distinction. I have seen it at several other restaurants too, and reading between the lines, "buey" is considered a selling point. It seems to matter to the Spanish. The burger came with a small bucket of fries. Pricing was also reasonable.

title_review: Hit and miss dishes. Fantastic dessert, good service
review_preview: Based on tripadvisor reviews, my friends and I made a reservation for the restaurant. Looking around, it seemed like many patrons were also there because of tripadvisor reviews. We didn't see many locals. Overall, I was slightly disappointed with the food because I was really...
review_full: Based on tripadvisor reviews, my friends and I made a reservation for the restaurant.  Looking around, it seemed like many patrons were also there because of tripadvisor reviews. We didn't see many locals. Overall, I was slightly disappointed with the food because I was really excited after reading all the fantastic reviews. The dessert saved the meal though! The bad: We tried the fried prawns and calamari, as well as a fish (main dish. can't remember what it was called). The dishes came quickly but were not hot, so I reckon they were cooked beforehand. They were too salty and did not taste very nice at all.  The good: While the mushroom risotto also showed up lukewarm, it was flavourful and rather tasty. We had 2 desserts - the berry cheesecake and the mango mousse. Both were amazing! The cheesecake is one of the best I've ever tasted. Not too dense nor light, and the berry sauce on top was the perfect mix of tartness and sweet. The mango mousse was a dessert-of-the-day, and also disappeared very quickly.  Based on the dessert alone I would have rated the restaurant 5, but with the disappointing main dishes I give it a 3.

title_review: Best lunch in Madrid, amazing flavors, friendly team!
review_preview: We arrived without a reservation, just hoping to get in before our reservation at the Prado.  We were very thankful they were able to serve us a quick lunch.  It was the best meal we had in Madrid.  Sadly I didn't take any photos as...
review_full: We arrived without a reservation, just hoping to get in before our reservation at the Prado. We were very thankful they were able to serve us a quick lunch. It was the best meal we had in Madrid. Sadly I didn't take any photos as we had arrived that day and I was rather tired. We had the fixed price menu, the lentils were amazing, incredible flavors! The steak was a perfect remedy for my jet lag. I was quite full but could not resist my apple cake dessert, heavenly! The chef came out and personally checked in with each table, it was a perfect lunch! I wish we could have eaten here again but time did not allow, will definitely go again on my next trip to Madrid! It's a bit challenging to find, look it up online before you go so you know how to find it, just a few blocks from the Prado.

title_review: Delicious beautifully prepared dishes from fresh ingredients
review_preview: We were looking for somewhere for a group of us and  stumbled across this place not far from our hotel in the Paseo del Prado.It s a small restaurant but the proprietor said he could fit 10 of us in very early - 9pm !...
review_full: We were looking for somewhere for a group of us and stumbled across this place not far from our hotel in the Paseo del Prado.It s a small restaurant but the proprietor said he could fit 10 of us in very early - 9pm ! When they opened ! This is Madrid! The food was terrific - to start most of us shared salads of rocket,goats cheese and walnuts , or brochettes of prawns and squid, which even the two squid- haters in our group, when persuaded to try, said was absolutely delicious . Most us had risotto as a main course -one with wild mushrooms and one with beef and peppers, both of which were superb and so rich that we hadn t room for pudding . The proprietor was charming - attentive and apologetic for a delay in serving our starters, which we were so busy chatting we hadn t noticed. I would certainly go there again next time I m in Madrid

If I was staying in the area again, I'd return.

review_preview: This is the second time we've been to La Tragantúa. It's a great place for lunch, and convenient to the Reina Sofia. It's now on our "must visit" list each time we come to Madrid because of the excellent food, attentive service and pleasant ambiance....
review_full: This is the second time we've been to La Tragantúa. It's a great place for lunch, and convenient to the Reina Sofia. It's now on our "must visit" list each time we come to Madrid because of the excellent food, attentive service and pleasant ambiance. On this visit, I had the Korean dumplings and a Lomo steak. The steak had a lot of fat still on it, but was cooked well (medium) and soft as butter to cut. My partner had the skewers of calamari and gambas, followed by the cod in basil. We also had deserts. The whole meal came to 70 euros, including wine. An absolute bargain

review_preview: We had a wonderful evening here. We booked in advance for 9pm, arrived a few minutes before, to find it tightly shuttered. The charming bar next door explained that it did not open until 9! We had a drink, and back again at about 9.10,...
review_full: We had a wonderful evening here. We booked in advance for 9pm, arrived a few minutes before, to find it tightly shuttered. The charming bar next door explained that it did not open until 9! We had a drink, and back again at about 9.10, and the restaurant was already full, with only our table waiting for us. Superb food, with special mention for (1). the scrambled eggs and mixed mushrooms, the eggs simply binding the enormous portion of mushrooms to form a delicious rich porridge , and (2.) the Avila steak - perfect, tender, delicious. There was no wine list available - some printing issue - and we were asked what kind of wine we liked, and they would choose something appropriate. They did, and it was!  The restaurant is quite smalI, and we talked to our neighbours, discovered they were staying in the same street as we were, so we walked home together had a drink on the way. So - this is a restaurant in which you make friends! I would highly recommend it. In fact, it was our favourite in the week of our stay

review_full: We stayed in Lavapies and this was close to our boutique hotel, but it was so good I would make a special trip to venture just a little outside of the touristy central area for this restaurant. Tapas are included when you purchase your drink (wine). The tapas were very good as well and more than just the bread and meat variety. It's rare that tapas comes with the drink in the touristy parts of Madrid, so this was a nice change. The food was amazingly good. We had the risotto, which was huge and fabulous. We also met another customer and he let us taste the fried fish he ordered and that was also very good. The staff and the regulars that go here were very friendly, which made the experience only better.

review_preview: We booked for dinner on the basis of other TA reviews and were so pleased we did...if we had gone before our last night in Madrid we might have gone twice. It is a small restaurant seating no more than 20 people. The food was...
review_full: We booked for dinner on the basis of other TA reviews and were so pleased we did...if we had gone before our last night in Madrid we might have gone twice. It is a small restaurant seating no more than 20 people. The food was superb, especially the stir fry beef with vegetables which had a delicious sauce. The waitress noted I was unable to eat fish or seafood and immediately provided me with an alternative appetiser which was very thoughtful. We shared two starters - Korean dumplings, and peppers wrapped in ham which was so good I am going to try to make them when we get home. We shared the white chocolate cheesecake with berry topping for dessert. The house red was very good. Service was good with 3 waiters, and the chef came out at the end of the meal and spoke to each guest. Highly recommended.

title_review: A neighborhood restaurant for visitors to Madrid
review_preview: Don't you love it when you go to a restaurant and have to wait and start with a drink until a table opens up...and the first ones to leave are a family?  Welcome to Taberna El Sur, an out-of-the-way gem with great atmosphere, wonderful staff...
review_full: Don't you love it when you go to a restaurant and have to wait and start with a drink until a table opens up...and the first ones to leave are a family? Welcome to Taberna El Sur, an out-of-the-way gem with great atmosphere, wonderful staff and even better food! Thanks to TripAdvisor, we found out about El Sur and walked there after the obligatory visit to the indoor market at San Miguel (There is a reason why it is something everyone does, by the way. Make sure you find out too!)  El Sur is a small restaurant filled with mostly locals. While we waited 10 minutes for a table to open up we enjoyed a glass of wine, munched on some olives and watched the staff interact with the customers. It was obvious they knew most of them. Once seated, we treated ourselves to a Mediterranean Salad (perfect oil & balsamic vinegar dressing!) while we waited for the Cuban take on a shredded flank steak, which was amazing (as were the fresh potato chips.). Alex, one of the great waiters, told us that the cook had worked in Cuba and brought the recipe with him. It may be just one of the small plates you order but it alone is worth the trip. We didn't stop there...a slice of Red Velvet cake ended a perfect meal in Madrid.   I love finding outstanding local restaurants, and Taberna El Sur is the perfect example; the locals love it, the people are friendly and want you to have a good time, and the food is outstanding! I wholeheartedly encourage you to see for yourself what the locals know already. You will be glad you did!

title_review: So Awesome I went two days in a row!
review_preview: I stayed in an Airbnb apartment about a 5 minute walk from the Anton Martin place and I was determined to find a decent 1st meal after my arrival.  Much to my dismay, quite a few places in the neighborhood don't speak English, so when...
review_full: I stayed in an Airbnb apartment about a 5 minute walk from the Anton Martin place and I was determined to find a decent 1st meal after my arrival. Much to my dismay, quite a few places in the neighborhood don't speak English, so when I stumbled upon El Sur, it was a complete God send. Jasmine immediately made me feel like family. I am vegetarian, so she replace the options on the lunch menu of the day with vegetarian options that she thought I'd love. She was right, everything I ate was amazing, service was top notch. She even made me a delicious summer drink and wrote down the ingredients for me which included one very special ingredient- "lot's of love". The next day prior to my evening flight, I decided to go out of my way to trek back to the neighborhood just to enjoy one last meal. I had a dish with eggs the previous day so Jasmine insisted she'd make me something different this time. The second meal was rice and sautéed veggies. They were seasoned perfectly and the meal was very filling. Both days I had tiramisu for dessert but there are an assortment of other options to choose from. If you find yourself in this neighborhood, do yourself and your stomach a favor and please visit El Sur. If you aren't in the neighborhood it is a couple blocks way from the Anton Martin metro and is well worth the trip! Thank you Jasmine, and the gentleman that was working there who's name I didn't catch. You left a positive lasting impression on me and I am grateful for your hospitality during my visit to Madrid.

We ordered the grilled octopus, risotto with shrimp, croquetas (4 mushroom and 4 ham), Roja Vieja, and Solomillo sur (pork with grapes and potatoes). Everything was amazing. My favorite was the risotto and grilled octopus. We loved our waiter. He went above and beyond to give us a great dining experience, giving us great tips about what to order, even telling us we shouldn't order so much as our American appetites wanted. He turned out to be just right with the amount of food. Our waiter also gave us 2 chocolate shots and 3 shot glasses with peach syrup and water for our kids; they loved it! And he decorated our chocolate cake with this cute smiley face. We would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the Madrid! Best food and service!

title_review: Spanish best cousine, from scratch, Family atmosphere.
review_preview: I love Paella, which is the specialty at this place. I ordered Paella at several restaurants during my vacation stay in Madrid. The best paella was the one served at this restaurant. In particular the Black Paella. The other restaurants had Paella that tasted like...
review_full: I love Paella, which is the specialty at this place. I ordered Paella at several restaurants during my vacation stay in Madrid. The best paella was the one served at this restaurant. In particular the Black Paella. The other restaurants had Paella that tasted like if it came out of a grocery's 3-minute meal box. Everything that I ordered in Puerta de Atocha tasted like cooked by my grandmother. The other thing that was a winner was the Mojito and the deserts. I highly recommend this restaurant for people that loves food. The waiters are also an important part of my family's good time at this place. In Spain is not customary to tip the waiters, and as such, they sometimes are rude. But the crew at Puerta de Atocha was extremely nice to me and my family; from acting as our photograph to taking orders out of the menu from my sons. Overall, money well spent at this restaurant. Prices are low considering the service and the quality of the food served. I ended up going to this place for dinner three times for Paella with the family and one late at night with the wife for Mojitos.

review_preview: If you are a foodie visiting Madrid, this tiny restaurant is a must!  They have a tasting menu, however we decided to make up our own. The grilled artichoke was delicious, the fried octopus tender and flavourful on a bed of mashed potato that was...
review_full: If you are a foodie visiting Madrid, this tiny restaurant is a must! They have a tasting menu, however we decided to make up our own. The grilled artichoke was delicious, the fried octopus tender and flavourful on a bed of mashed potato that was a perfect foil for it. The beef steaks were seasoned perfectly and cooked exactly as we wanted them. The tuna was moist and sumptuous. For dessert we chose to share a piece of orange chocolate cake because we were so full. It was heavenly, served warm, with a rich vanilla ice cream. Be warned, the piece is small, (looks more like a brownie) but oh so worth it! This was a meal I will remember, and be sad that it is in Spain, and I am not. As a side note, this is not an inexpensive meal, it was our splurge for the trip. But oh what a splurge! €150 for 4 of us. If you can afford it.... GO!

review_preview: La Tragantua is a very small restaurant with tables squeezed and it is almost impossible to find a table without booking in advance. We have been there around 20:00 and been given a very small table on condition that we would leave before 22:00 which...
review_full: La Tragantua is a very small restaurant with tables squeezed and it is almost impossible to find a table without booking in advance. We have been there around 20:00 and been given a very small table on condition that we would leave before 22:00 which was ok for us. Our table was the last available one in the restaurant, so those coming after us had to leave for another restaurant. First of all, La Tragantua has a very nice and friendly owner/manager, called Pablo. In addition to the waiters, he is taking care of all the tables himself and dealing with you personally. But the place is very very small. It has just a few tables, squeezed to serve more people. It also looks popular among tourists since most of the guests were tourists like us when we were there. Me and my friend have tried steak and local beer. Though we would also order salad, the table was so small that it did not have room for it. I do not remember what type of steaks we have ordered but we liked our dishes. The steaks were juicy and delicious. There was only one bothering issue for both of us. I have ordered medium but my steak was rare (almost bleeding) and my friend has ordered well done and ended-up with medium steak. Last but not least, the prices were average for this type of restaurant but above tapas restaurants. Steaks were between 20-25 Euros if I remember correctly and we paid around 60-65 Euros for our dinner (2 steaks, 2 beers, 1 bottle of water). Though the place was very crowded and small, service was fast; staff was polite and friendly and food was good. Thus, La Tragantua is among the places I would recommend. Just keep in mind that steak is less grilled than you order, so beware of a rare one!

title_review: so good we had to come back
review_preview: this place is off the beaten track. We went because we were lucky enough that my wife's boss worked in Madrid and recommended it. We walked in at 10.00pm without a reservation on a Monday night, seeing the place full we were worried that we...
review_full: this place is off the beaten track. We went because we were lucky enough that my wife's boss worked in Madrid and recommended it. We walked in at 10.00pm without a reservation on a Monday night, seeing the place full we were worried that we got in too late, however, this is Madrid and we just had to wait 20 minutes sat at the bar and we had a table. Every single dish was excellent. Service was friendly, the 80s music pleased older people like us. We returned the following day for lunch, our last meal in Spain as we were returning home that evening. on the second visit I will just tell you the two dishes my wife and I had to have again: the musaka (different from anything we have had in Greece) and tortilla de potatos. But like us, dont limit yourself to two dishes, and if you are about to order too many they will stop you from doing so.

A real tavern with a huge bar and narrow corridor with tiny tables lining the wall and several tables in the back. It was full of locals and a few tourists. We thought the staff was very friendly and welcoming but not pushy. My daughter knew we were in a non touristy place mainly because we spoke in broken Spanish and they spoke little English yet they accommodated every request. Thank you to our waiter Ghoan. Food was fresh, delicious and plentiful. Salads and the salmon tempura were outstanding. We would highly recommend Taberna El Sur

review_preview: We enjoyed a great lunch at this place, which is located at a quiet street off Prado museum.  Here's what we loved:  mushroom risotto, shrimp and calamari skewers, goat cheese salad, house red.   Here's what we liked:  beef and pepper risotto, beef with blue cheese...
review_full: We enjoyed a great lunch at this place, which is located at a quiet street off Prado museum. Here's what we loved: mushroom risotto, shrimp and calamari skewers, goat cheese salad, house red. Here's what we liked: beef and pepper risotto, beef with blue cheese (daily special), fried provolone. The food was good, service was excellent, but prices were high for Madrid. Because we had made an online reservation (using Tripadvisor), we werent able to take advantage of the daily special, which was a 3 course menu for 13 euro. Our total ended up to close to 100 euro for 4. Reasonable for big cities, but high for Madrid where you can get very nice food for less. (see my other reviews)

review_preview: Great place tucked away off atocha, minutes from the museums. The owner/servers are fantastic and the food is the best I had during my time in Madrid (aside from the pizza from pizzatecca, nearby)!  Had the arugula salad and fried cod dish, which was above...
review_full: Great place tucked away off atocha, minutes from the museums. The owner/servers are fantastic and the food is the best I had during my time in Madrid (aside from the pizza from pizzatecca, nearby)! Had the arugula salad and fried cod dish, which was above change up from the ham/pork and bread that seems to be the bulk of what's offered in Madrid. The salad had a tad too much dressing (which was an amazing balsamic/honey mustard blend) and the cod was a little undercooked/under fried, but all in all the food was good. Will def be coming back when I return! Also, only ~40 euro for the salad, entree, dessert (a great cheesecake!) and a coke and water (which you're changed for everywhere on Europe)!

title_review: Friendly, lively place with limited menu
review_preview: We went to this lively place last night after reading other trip advisor reviews. It is more bar than restaurant, very friendly - our waiter Alex, asked to be mentioned in my review after he asked me how we'd found them - and filled with...
review_full: We went to this lively place last night after reading other trip advisor reviews. It is more bar than restaurant, very friendly - our waiter Alex, asked to be mentioned in my review after he asked me how we'd found them - and filled with more locals than tourists. The restaurant tables are in the back. What I didn't glean from the reviews is that the menu is somewhat limited. My wife had a meditaranian salad and I had ham and eggs, which they served over fried potatoes. They do give a basket of bread and don't charge for it which some of the better restaurants seem to do for their rolls. The couple next to us shared an egg dish and croquettes to begin and then had a pork dish to finish. The pork looked good but I had had a similar dish at another restaurant the night before and found the sauce odd and thefore avoided it. The drinks are good here and I had a margarita and though they say they understand English, I had asked for no salt on the rim but got it anyway. We did see others having cake desserts but we passed on that.  If you are looking for a moderately priced and local kind of place, I'd give this a try. But if you are really hungry and want a broad menu, go somewhere else.

title_review: Great place for lunch and a great gin and tonic
review_preview: My wife, 3 year old daughter and I had lunch here in September 2015.  We got to the restaurant around noon probably and there were only a few other folks eating at the same time so it was not busy at all.  As other reviewers...
review_full: My wife, 3 year old daughter and I had lunch here in September 2015. We got to the restaurant around noon probably and there were only a few other folks eating at the same time so it was not busy at all. As other reviewers have stated it is very family friendly and is reasonably priced. While my wife and I ate, my 3 year old daughter played matchbox cars and trucks with I believe the owner's 4 year old daughter. They both had a great time. The food was very good and was served fairly quickly after ordering. After having a beer with lunch I decided to try a gin and tonic. What a great choice! It was the best gin and tonic I ever had and is quite large. The bartender did a lot of work to prepare the drink by putting lemongrass in it and also shaving the lime. The waitress poured the gin right at the table into the glass. I probably should have had another one. I believe the gin and tonic was 5 or 6 euros which I thought was quite reasonable. I would definitely come back here the next time that I am in Madrid.

It was packed each time we went, but we were lucky enough to get a table. The staff was very helpful and welcoming, and the food and wine was outstanding. We chose from the menu of the day, which was a great deal, with everything delicious. I bet dinner is a real treat. Don't miss this place if you're in Madrid.

review_preview: Just like the other Steakburger restaurants in Madrid, this one cooks the burger just the way you like it. Rare, Medium or well done. Most places in Madrid don't cook well done the way it should be, which is without blood dripping from it! Steakburger...

Most places in Madrid don't cook well done the way it should be, which is without blood dripping from it! Steakburger gets it right every time, no matter which branch you are in. It is also home to the nicest beer I have ever tasted, anywhere. The staff are nice and helpful, and the food comes quickly enough considering that it is cooked for you from scratch. SO like my other Steakburger review, this is a 5 star thumbs up from me! Cheers.

title_review: Consistently good Burgers from Steakburger, no matter which branch you visit
review_preview: As usual, great Burgers, cooked to your liking, even if you like it well done, it will be cooked and be presented without blood, which is more than I can say for several burger joints in Madrid. If you want it to have blood, you...
review_full: As usual, great Burgers, cooked to your liking, even if you like it well done, it will be cooked and be presented without blood, which is more than I can say for several burger joints in Madrid. If you want it to have blood, you can get that too from a rare or medium cooked burger. And also, the beer, like I said in my previous steakburger review, is second to none. The nicest beer I have ever tasted. Wait staff are friendly and helpful and the service is quick enough, considering they have to cook your burger from scratch. If you get your food too soon, that would be a worry. That doesn't happen here, because it is done correctly. I'm a big fan of this branch in Madrid, and all other Steakburgers I have visited. Cheers!

Our server was fantastic! He was very friendly and attentive. My husband ordered a glass of house red wine and I had a sparkling water with lemon. We began dinner with bread and olive oil and then had the most fantastic Burrata Cheese Salad with tomatoes, pine nuts, arugula, and sea salt. We both had the roasted chicken breast for an entreé and it is was very moist and tender. I had a dessert wine, which our server recommended.

review_preview: This place was recommended by a friend who had visited Madrid a year ago, and he said he went back 3 times during his visit! After trying it out, I can understand why.  It's a small place, with limited seating, but has a lovely warm...
review_full: This place was recommended by a friend who had visited Madrid a year ago, and he said he went back 3 times during his visit! After trying it out, I can understand why. It's a small place, with limited seating, but has a lovely warm atmosphere. We were there early for lunch (by Madrid standards - at about 1.30pm), so the wait at the bar was only about 15 mins. The food is excellent - we had an eclectic mix of salads, the famous spanish omelette with potato, croquetas, paella and the ropa vieja. The ropa vieja is a cuban style shredded beef and it was delicious. We also saw lots of people ordering the pulpo (the octopus) which looked fantastic as well. Oh well, next time... I highly recommend this place - both for the food, and the fantastic service. Although they were extremely busy, Jhoan and Frank were friendly and good humoured and really attentive. I have eaten at some places in Madrid where the food is good, but the service is barely civil. It is not like this in Taberna El Sur, which makes it such a find in Madrid. It's a great atmosphere to get a taste of good food in Madrid!

title_review: The best one in Spain so far!!
review_preview: I was a bit skeptical because of the location but don’t let that fool you! This place seriously deserves all the stars it can get! The food is so incredibly rich and flavorful that it left me wanting for more even though I couldn’t fit...
review_full: I was a bit skeptical because of the location but don’t let that fool you! This place seriously deserves all the stars it can get! The food is so incredibly rich and flavorful that it left me wanting for more even though I couldn’t fit anymore in. We ordered the Butter Chicken and Chicken Tikka Masala. The Butter Chicken was so incredibly amazing. It was cooked to perfection. The spice level I asked for was perfect. The Chicken Tikka Masala was also very good. My husband wouldn’t stop complementing it. The garlic naan was probably the BEST garlic naan I’ve ever had. It was huge!! The texture was soft and very fresh. It went so well with dipping it in our chicken entrees.  The service was very good as well. We appreciated the waiter letting us know the garlic naan was big when we asked for two initially. He recommended to start with one and that was a very good advice! We couldn’t have finished two.  Also, shout out to the owner. He was very attentive and kind to us. If we ever come back to Madrid again, this will be my first go to spot each time! Thank you for your amazing, authentic, tasty food. 5 stars from the both of us!!

title_review: Great before/after The Prado; make a reservation
review_preview: Intimate, conveniently located and casually elegant pretty much describe this tiny (only 7 tables) restaurant offering farm-to-table cuisine. White asparagus was in season when we visited, so we shared a plate for an appetizer. There was a scallop special as well (which my wife ordered),...
review_full: Intimate, conveniently located and casually elegant pretty much describe this tiny (only 7 tables) restaurant offering farm-to-table cuisine. White asparagus was in season when we visited, so we shared a plate for an appetizer. There was a scallop special as well (which my wife ordered), while I had the Atlantic cod loin served over pureed potatoes with a mild honey rosemary sauce. Located between the south end of The Prado and the Royal Botanical Garden of Madrid, The Spanish Farm is a perfect complement for either lunch or dinner following a visit to The Prado. Open for lunch from 1:00 - 4:30pm every day except Monday and for dinner from 7:30 – 11:00 pm Tuesday through Saturday, it is a good idea to make a reservation (ask for a window table; there are only 2).
