review_preview: You always know when you come to a foreign country and westerners recommend a restaurant - it should be avoided at all costs. One of the primary reasons I came to Spain was to indulge in the famous "Tapas" as much as possible. I have...
review_full: You always know when you come to a foreign country and westerners recommend a restaurant - it should be avoided at all costs.  One of the primary reasons I came to Spain was to indulge in the famous "Tapas" as much as possible. I have a passion for food, in particular flavour and I love the Spanish culture. I particulalrly like to try neighbourhood restaurants where the locals hang out and Taberna el Sur seemed to fit the bill. From the moment my wife and I wer greeted by the barmen and the skillful way he made our cocktails in a busy and bustling albeit predominantly westerner filled resutaruant (I put my prejudices aside) to being led to our table it was great - but thats where it ended. Regardless of the 600+ acolades about the food it was at very best best... average. I'm sorry boys nothing tradiotional in the Caesar Salad. Particulalry the dressing and though the Porlk fillet was tender the Port reduction sauce it came with was too creamy and had no essence of port at all. This place has great potential, excellent and clearly hard working staff, but when it comes to flavour... it doesn't cost any more to provide it.

Food was superbly elaborated, not extremely spicy (kids ate well), neither heavy. PREMISES: clean, lean, warm. Cozy local, you feel really at ease inside. Bathroom clean and tidy. It was not crowded when we went, which makes you feel calm and relaxed. PRICES: not overpriced at all. Quality-Quantity-Price: very well balanced ratio. a place I definitely recommend if you want to get real good mexican food!

title_review: Even though we were not in Mexico...
review_preview: Our last night in Madrid we chose to do a progressive dinner with multiple stops for small bites, ending up near our apartment in La Latina. Tacos and Tapas was our final stop and the absolutely blew us away. We vacation in Cabo San Lucas...
review_full: Our last night in Madrid we chose to do a progressive dinner with multiple stops for small bites, ending up near our apartment in La Latina. Tacos and Tapas was our final stop and the absolutely blew us away. We vacation in Cabo San Lucas every spring and feel we have had excellent Mexican food of all kinds, including eating at the homes of local residents. This night surpassed every on e of those, hands down! Simple lamb and pork tacos, seasoned to perfection, accompanied by excellent and generous margaritas and followed by cheese quesadillas were exactly what we wanted after 5 days of fabulous Spanish meals. Simple, stylish surroundings complimented by superb service and the above mentioned food, sent us on to Portugal for our next food adventures. Outstanding food and very reasonable prices will please anyone looking for a taste of Mexico while in Madrid.

Typical spanish sandwich (bocadillo), no cheese, no sauces or anything else, just a slice of first-class jamon iberico in a baguette, probably the best I tried in Madrid! Delicious and great prices, too! If you ever visit Madrid, do your self a favor and try some sandwiches at this amazing place!

Can definitely find a place with better food and in a better area too.

review_full: The ham sandwich was the first thing I wanted to eat when I got to Madrid. It is a great price and a no-frills sandwich; just a piece of thinly sliced ham on a baguette, no sauce, no condiments, nothing to take away the taste of this salty, delish ham. And, the staff was always friendly and personable when I stopped in. They also have doughnuts and basic pastries, but why would you eat that when you can eat a ham sandwich? Good for breakfast or lunch or whenever!

review_preview: My girlfriend and I grabbed a couple of sandwiches from here on our way to the airport at around 4am, so that we wouldn't get hungry and have to buy even more expensive plane food. The guy behind the counter was really friendly, but the...
review_full: My girlfriend and I grabbed a couple of sandwiches from here on our way to the airport at around 4am, so that we wouldn't get hungry and have to buy even more expensive plane food. The guy behind the counter was really friendly, but the main reason we chose here was just because the prices weren't bad and it was open late.  The sandwiches were all premade at this time, but this meant we could be on our way faster I guess. Unfortunately, the option was solely Iberico Jamon, with no option to add some cheese to it. The ham was tasty, though the bread a little stale after having been out all day: a little tough to chew and hard that it hurt your gum in places. Still, far better than anything we could have got at the airport or on the plane, and better value for money.

I asked for the bread and apperitifs which was a basket of mixed breads served with a red pepper mousse. My main was the Confit duck’s leg with an impeccably smooth celeriac purée and orange sauce and to finish, a nicely tart passion fruit custard with edible flower and popping candy. An oasis just minutes from the Botanic Garden and the Prado.

review_full: Cuando daba por perdido poder disfrutar de nuevo de los fantásticos "momos" nepalíes me encuentro que han abierto justo un restaurante nepalí en Madrid. ¡El único de la ciudad! El trato es increíble por parte del personal y siempre buscan ayudarte con su mejor sonrisa.  No olvidéis probar los momos o el ron en forma de khukuri (cuchillo típico nepalí) =) When I almost over to lost my hope to find again the awesome nepalese "momos", I found one new opening nepalese restaurant in Madrid. The only one in the city! The restaurant staff are really kind and good people, and always are looking for how can help you with a smile. Don't forget to taste the "momos" or the kukri-shape rum (a typical knife of Nepal) =) -Sergio Blanco-

title_review: At last, a decent Nepalese/Indian restaurant in Madrid
review_preview: I've had great Indian and Nepalese food in the UK, but never really here in Madrid, even in Lavapies.  Great food here, a full menu, reasonable prices and excellent friendly service.  Heartily recommended - we've been three times already since its opening.Onion bhajis and...
review_full: I've had great Indian and Nepalese food in the UK, but never really here in Madrid, even in Lavapies. Great food here, a full menu, reasonable prices and excellent friendly service. Heartily recommended - we've been three times already since its opening. Onion bhajis and lemon rice recommended as well as the nan breads and main courses and vegetable dishes! The food's not too oily as many Indian restaurants serve it. You can ask for the heat factor to be adjusted to your taste, and the staff are so friendly.

We enjoyed the peaceful ambience and exciting, delicious plates of food. I am sure that if we lived in Madrid, I would want to visit more than once so that I could try more of the many appealing seasonal menu items.

title_review: Fresh, local, food with a personal touch
review_preview: We love this place. We went 3 times during our stay in Madrid -- it was that comfortable and delicious! Very convenient to the museums and to where we were staying. We tried 3 sharing dishes for our lunch (for 2 people) plus some lovely...
review_full: We love this place. We went 3 times during our stay in Madrid -- it was that comfortable and delicious! Very convenient to the museums and to where we were staying. We tried 3 sharing dishes for our lunch (for 2 people) plus some lovely wine and had such a great experience we decided to come back for dinner. All in all, we tried almost every item on the menu! The menu does change seasonally so you might not find what we found when you visit, but you can be certain that whatever they are preparing will be fresh, beautifully prepared, and delicious. Standouts on our trip: cheese platter, Iberian ham, burrata with tapenade, cod, a beautiful tomato salad with tropical fruits, passionfruit dessert, and the amazing sherry. Wines are also good and well priced. And the service is spectacular. Our waiter was so warm and welcoming. On our last visit, the owner also came out to meet us and spoke with us for a while. We also got into a conversation with the people at the next table -- one of whom was the restaurant's bread supplier! (Bread is delicious, too!) I would recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a delicious, low-key place to eat.

title_review: Lived up to expectations & more EXCEPTIONAL
review_preview: Planned a romantic weekend away with my wife and wanted to make it special, after reading other reviews I booked in here, The day before the booking someone called me to confirm my reservation and was one of the politest people I've spoken to. On...
review_full: Planned a romantic weekend away with my wife and wanted to make it special, after reading other reviews I booked in here, The day before the booking someone called me to confirm my reservation and was one of the politest people I've spoken to. On arriving in Madrid I stupidly forgot to change my watch forward the 1 hour, we arrived at the restaurant the hour late, the owner (I think) totally understood and was so polite and courteous, he even apologised that he couldn't fit us in but directed us to two alternatives.  With a strong desire to eat here I re-booked for the Monday lunchtime, WOW so glad we did, the welcome is so sincere and you're made to feel as though you've been invited into his home. Even though its so small its managed superbly, you don't feel the the other diners are intruding on your space & the food - well what can I say magnificent, both my wife & I rate it as one of the best we've eaten at.  Thank you for making our Madrid trip end in style. Chris & Adele Davis

review_preview: I never thought I would write a review for a burger restaurant, but this one merits a good one. On a Saturday night I Had no reservations at any restaurant,  so my choices were few. I ended up in Steak Burger near my hotel. I...
review_full: I never thought I would write a review for a burger restaurant, but this one merits a good one. On a Saturday night I Had no reservations at any restaurant, so my choices were few. I ended up in Steak Burger near my hotel.  I liked many things about it. You're able to choose the size of your hamburger meat, there was a choice of beef or ox, a choice of buns, but most importantly, they cook the burger to your desired doneness. I like my meat rare and that's exactly what I got. I would recommend the Las Pampas Burger, which had caramelized onions, chimichurri sauce and mayonnaise as well as some cheese. A well-made burger cost at least $10 in the states and this is about what it costs here. There are many other options including some more highbrow ones but they do nice fries and onion rings and also shakes.

review_preview: Got in as it opened at 9pm with the fiance and had an amazing time. The place is really small but nice and intimate. There was a table of around 16 sat as we got there so I thought we would be in for long...
review_full: Got in as it opened at 9pm with the fiance and had an amazing time. The place is really small but nice and intimate. There was a table of around 16 sat as we got there so I thought we would be in for long waits for courses and service. The service, however, was spot on. The owner was very helpful and informative and despite the throng of people, our food and drinks came in perfect time. As for the food: had the Boletus mushrooms with scrambled eggs for starters - got all of the mushroom flavors, very tasty, for mains we had the turkish burger which was incredible, as it was 2 juicy beef burgers surrounding a piece of goats cheese and caramelized onion. I had the steak, which was slightly too undercooked for me so they whipped it back and brought it out perfectly cooked. Cant recommend this place enough. Theres also a nice little bar up the road if you have to wait.

review_preview: This quaint local place was recommended by a friend from Madrid.  Very small and was a little hard to find – use Google maps for best directions.  Even though we arrived around 8pm so a bit early for the usual time for dinner, we were...
review_full: This quaint local place was recommended by a friend from Madrid. Very small and was a little hard to find – use Google maps for best directions. Even though we arrived around 8pm so a bit early for the usual time for dinner, we were lucky to get a table for three people. Very busy but the service was excellent (our server had lived in NYC for a few years so we talked to him about his time in the U.S.). The food was prepared quickly despite the full house. Everything was terrific! Shared some tapas with two business colleagues and had a few glasses of Albarino which were excellent and only 2-3 euros per glass! Try the grilled squid, croquetas, patatas bravas and ropavieja! Total bill was only 40 euros for dinner for three people so a great value for some great local fare!

title_review: Hands down best Indian Restaurant in Madrid
review_preview: I am in the process of overcoming my strong addiction to the food at this place that I visit every 2 weeks on average. I have lived in Madrid for over 22 years and always loved traveling to the UK or Southern Spain to get...
review_full: I am in the process of overcoming my strong addiction to the food at this place that I visit every 2 weeks on average. I have lived in Madrid for over 22 years and always loved traveling to the UK or Southern Spain to get a taste of an authentic Indian dish because I never found this in Madrid. I discovered Everest about 2 years ago and am open to finding a better gem in Madrid, however, I have tried about 90% of Indian restaurants listed in Trip Advisor (all of the top rated) and Everest is in another league. Parking is difficult in this area but I normally find a spot in less than 5 minutes. My favorite plates are: Butter Chicken, Jalfrezi, Bhuna, and the Momos. The cheese naan is always fresh and moist. The staff is great and the kitchen is fast. This is not a luxurious restaurant but the quality is amazing with authentic new flavors I didn’t know existed forcing me to crave this stuff every week. It would be great if they had a better wine selection but the amazing food puts this restaurant apart from the rest. I will continue to go back religiously.

title_review: A Small place but the food is good!
review_preview: This place is small, 9 tables max. Make sure you make a reservation otherwise you may not get a meal. We went there for lunch at 1:30 pm. There were only 2 tables occupied when we got there but within 5-10 minutes of being seated,...
review_full: This place is small, 9 tables max. Make sure you make a reservation otherwise you may not get a meal. We went there for lunch at 1:30 pm. There were only 2 tables occupied when we got there but within 5-10 minutes of being seated, the whole place became packed. I made the reservation through www,thefork.com which entitles one to get a 30% discount if you order a main course plus either an appetizer OR dessert. If you order off the set menu of the day selection, these do not qualify for the discount.  I ordered from the menu of the day choices while my wife ordered from the a la carte menu. The menu of the day includes an appetizer, a main course, dessert and a drink (soda, beer, wine, or water) all for 13 euros! That's a great deal in my opinion. I ordered risotto for my starter and chicken stew for my main course. My wife ordered a spinach salad followed by a mushroom risotto for her main course. The food was yummy. The risotto was very rich, creamy and tasty. My wife's spinach salad was simply delicious. The chicken stew was good. You can't beat their menu of the day in terms of quality, price and value. The service was so-so because there were 2 servers for the whole place and they were busy. The owner came in to introduce himself and to make sure everything was OK. I thought that was a nice gesture and the clients certainly appreciated this.  This restaurant is near the Prado and Reina Sofia Museums. It is definitely a good place to go for either lunch or dinner.

review_preview: Came to this place for lunch as we wanted some tapas and we found it on Tripadvisor where it was highly rated. The place has a great atmosphere, with Mexican music in the background. We ordered some quesadillas and tacos to share, and we had...
review_full: Came to this place for lunch as we wanted some tapas and we found it on Tripadvisor where it was highly rated.  The place has a great atmosphere, with Mexican music in the background. We ordered some quesadillas and tacos to share, and we had mixed feelings about it.  The quesadillas, although basic with ham and cheese, were pretty good, especially with the hot sauce.  We were expecting the tacos to be hard shell, but they were in fact soft shell. To be fair, that wasn’t specified in the menu, but it would have helped. The pork and lamb tacos were really good, but the mint sauce was quite bad, it almost tasted like toothpaste.  The high point of that lunch was the hot sauce which made everything better. I would return to the place for some quick bites and a few cervezas.

They have English menus, so it helps. As for the food, I have nothing bad to say! Nothing was overdone, and the portions were perfect. I would go back to this place in a heartbeat.

Arroz meloso in the Asturian style was solid--saffron rice with pieces of chorizo. The famous French hamburger was not bad, though we are not fans of the strongly flavored cheese that topped it. Steak was a big plain slab with too few potatoes. My partner and others around us had to send back their food for recooking as it was underdone. Plates were too big to conveniently fit on the tables. Again, we really like the owner based on our friendly conversations, but we were disappointed by the food since, based on the high ratings we expected to be wowed.

review_preview: I came here on my last night in Madrid, and boy was it a great choice! It's a little hidden, away from the tourist area, although it is frequented by both tourists and locals. I had read many of the reviews here, and I have...
review_full: I came here on my last night in Madrid, and boy was it a great choice! It's a little hidden, away from the tourist area, although it is frequented by both tourists and locals. I had read many of the reviews here, and I have to add to the great comments. I was helped right away by the server, Alex, who was very nice. He was very attentive, and gave me options for my wine, to which I asked him to surprise me. He always came by to ask how things were. I ordered a half portion of the croquetas. They were delicious! I also ordered a full order of the squid (chipirones a la plancha). This was so delicious. Best squid I've tasted! Alex also agreed it was such a good dish, and then offered me dessert options, to which he recommended the passion fruit tart. Boy, was that delicious! It was quite inexpensive, and I would definitely return on my next trip here. Thank you, Alex for the great service!

review_preview: We stumbled across this restaurant while looking for a dinner place in La Latina - if I had not known it from TripAdvisor, we probably would not have noticed it. We even hesitated to go in as we already had mexican tapas the night before...
review_full: We stumbled across this restaurant while looking for a dinner place in La Latina - if I had not known it from TripAdvisor, we probably would not have noticed it. We even hesitated to go in as we already had mexican tapas the night before - but damn I'm glad we entered eventually.  The place is small, almost tiny - 12 seats if I remember correctly. We were a group of 4, so we were lucky that another party was about to leave. The decoration is minimalistic, clean and not like the usual mexican restaurant.  The place is also pretty new and run by 2 mexican gentlemen, you can see that they really put a lot of effort & heart in it. The food was excellent, homemade Nachos and everything fresh & super tasty, TOP quality and not overpriced.  Authentic mexican menu and some interesting cocktails - try the Ojo Rojo if you're brave. But what made the evening really outstanding for us was the excellent service. The older waiter was really attentive and charming and communicated with us in both english & spanish. My personal highlight was when I asked if I could keep the empy beer bottle (I collect beer bottles from all around the world). Not only did he wash it for me, he then even gave me a bag with 3 more different bottles that I could add to my collection. Actually not a big deal, but just that extra bit of great service that not everyone would think of.Oh Yeah, and the round of Tequila on the house didn't hurt either.

title_review: Excellent Authentic Mexican Food tucked away in La Latina
review_preview: This place is a beautiful place tucked away in La Latina, perfect for a cozy night out for friends or couples. The food is consistently fantastic across the board - just like they serve back in Mexico. Tacos are around 3.00 / 3.50 a piece...
review_full: This place is a beautiful place tucked away in La Latina, perfect for a cozy night out for friends or couples. The food is consistently fantastic across the board - just like they serve back in Mexico. Tacos are around 3.00 / 3.50 a piece and worth every penny. As I'm writing this, the restaurant is ranked as Madrid's second best and I would say that's a pretty fair assessment. The owner even ended the evening with a free shot of tequila on the house. We leave Madrid tomorrow, but if we weren't heading out, we would certainly come back! If you don't speak in English, don't worry -there is an English menu. We spoke in English, French and Spanish with the owner and server, no problems communicating at all.

review_preview: We had an absolutely fantastic experience here! We were a group of 5 from Los Angeles traveling throughout Europe.  We had dinner at La Tragantua on our first night in Madrid, and I can't express enough how this completely unassuming establishment exceeded all of our...
review_full: We had an absolutely fantastic experience here! We were a group of 5 from Los Angeles traveling throughout Europe. We had dinner at La Tragantua on our first night in Madrid, and I can't express enough how this completely unassuming establishment exceeded all of our expectations. We had the best meal of the entire trip here....and we just came from Paris and Barcelona! Pablo (owner of the restaurant) greeted us as we walked up, he knew my name, and he seated us immediately. He walked us through the menu, and we ended up up going with the tasting which was paired with a great bottle of wine. He allowed us to order more of any dish we wanted - which we did! The peppers wrapped in jamon, the goat cheese salad, the risotto....all done very well. We also ended up buying a couple bottles of the wine we drank during dinner. Oh and our server - sassy and sweet! She made our dinner experience even more memorable. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone staying in Madrid - it's a perfect example of Madrid's hospitality, as well as a well executed traditional meal with a modern twist! Cheers!

We had a crisp white wine, for €15, then shared numerous dishes, including Cuban beef, grilled prawns, steak with Roquefort. We were persuaded by our waiter to try passion fruit pie, which was sublime. We followed our meal with more cocktails & coffee, our bill was ridiculously cheap at less than €120. We enjoyed this restaurant so much that we are returning when we visit Madrid next weekend for the Real Madrid v Barca match. The staff are so helpful & friendly we would recommend to anyone!!

review_preview: My husband and I happened to go to this restaurant for lunch. The owner and his partner were very nice and gave great hospitality. Right, food! We ordered guacamole and chicken fajita. The guacamole was superb! My mouth was full of the taste and aroma...
review_full: My husband and I happened to go to this restaurant for lunch. The owner and his partner were very nice and gave great hospitality.  Right, food! We ordered guacamole and chicken fajita. The guacamole was superb! My mouth was full of the taste and aroma of onion and avocado. It was smooth; you could swallow it without hesitation. The spicy sauce that accompanied it made you feel even hungrier. Chicken fajita was good too although, in my opinion, the guacamole was better. Very delicious.  We had the guavas in red wine sauce to close. We have never tasted such a dessert before! I won't "drink" the syrup sauce for any of the desserts except this one. It was just too good to describe. The guavas were soaked with the red wine sauce and the flavor went all the way inside. A dessert that was not "sweet" to Spanish standard, I guess, and full of flavor of red wine. We just couldn't let it stop. We ordered the 2nd and the last dessert on the list, which was a gelatin in vanilla (like panna cotta). Good but not as amazing as the guavas. Anyhow, we were more than satisfied with the dishes.  More to say, the owner treated us two glasses of tequila. A heaven way to finish the meal.

review_preview: As far as quality service goes, La Tragantua gets high marks. The attention they pay to each table is warm yet unobtrusive, such is the pride they have in hosting guests. This is what strikes you upon arrival.We had a reservation for opening time...
review_full: As far as quality service goes, La Tragantua gets high marks. The attention they pay to each table is warm yet unobtrusive, such is the pride they have in hosting guests. This is what strikes you upon arrival. We had a reservation for opening time at 9pm and when we arrived at 855pm, there were already two tables seated and ready to order. Once more, eating at 9pm is a real challenge for us folk used to having dinner much earlier. The restaurant seats at most 30 and was fully booked for the evening, so best make reservations ahead of time.  We had no trouble finding the place as it is right across the Prado, sandwiched between plaza Plateria de Martinez and calle Gobernador. If you're coming from the Prado, use the traffic crossing at plaza Murillo, which is located right between the Prado and the Real Jardin Botanico. You'll find plaza Plateria de Martinez after crossing the road. Walk up and make a left onto calle Alameda. Calle de la Veronica will be on your right; walk to the top of this street and La Tragantua is on your left. All this is just a 7 minute walk. There is a Carrefour Express at the square at calle Alameda/Veronica/Gobernador. Pardon the loooooong preamble. Here goes the food review. We had the prawn and squid skewers for starters and they were fussfree, yummy warm-ups. The prawns and squid are lightly battered and fried. The prawns have a bite to them while the squid is tender. This all goes with their garlic alioli. Our mains were the truffle ravioli and medium rare filet Mignon. The truffle ravioli was good without the taste being overwhelming. We've always found truffle makes everything delicious but can also be too much of a good thing. The serving might be a little small for a big man. Which is where the filet Mignon comes in. This is a thick cut of very tender beef, seared nicely on both sides, served with whole roasted onions and roasted potatos. The serving is truly a handful/big mouthful, and is good for sharing. If anything, we would have wanted it cooked a little longer. The steak is thick and the insides could be a little rare for some. It was overall a very good dish for us. The star for us though was the cheesecake: this homemade sweet is pure bliss. The cranberry sauce on top is a wonderful sweet addition as are the crunchy digestive biscuits crumbs tossed around the cake. But nothing detracts from the cheesecake itself. It is a must-have! There is a tasting menu as well that other reviewers have mentioned. Do ask to see the courses before deciding on your meal. They start at 35.50 euro per person and include many items.  Service is wonderful as aforementioned and dishes come out relatively quickly. We had Daniel attend to us all evening and the man is warm and genuine. His recommendation of tinto de verano con limon was spot on (red wine and lemon juice haha, we had to make it sound classy and local didn't we!) At the end of it all, we were given a 10% discount for booking online, something we forgot about but thrown in honestly by Pablo. Total cost including 3 huge glasses of drinks was 58 Euros. A very wonderful evening.

review_preview: This was one of a couple of restaurants we visited on a weekend break purely off the back of online reviews, so I'm quite happy to continue the trend. Trust me, dining here you will feel very well looked after. It's a cosy little place...
review_full: This was one of a couple of restaurants we visited on a weekend break purely off the back of online reviews, so I'm quite happy to continue the trend. Trust me, dining here you will feel very well looked after. It's a cosy little place so it's impressive that they achieve so much in the space - reservations would seem to be essential. We had a table booked at 9pm and by 9:30 the place was full, with people being turned away on the door. The ambiance and fixtures made for a really relaxed, welcoming atmosphere throughout.  You can dine a la carte but we went for one of the sample menus, around E45 for what turned into about 7 courses, including wine, so superb value. The team really put an effort into making it a 'dining experience', each course is like a little show-stealer with some great ideas and twists using great ingredients. The only thing I wasn't blown away by was the beef, perhaps because I was envious of the main course choice of the guy at the table next to me.  All in all a definite must-do for a great night out. You will wonder how they can keep the menu prices down so low.

review_preview: Although near three major art galleries, there is a dearth of small friendly restaurants on the eastern side of Paseo del Prado.  This fits the bill in every way: bright yet intimate, the menu (in Spanish and English) is on the short side but comprehensive...
review_full: Although near three major art galleries, there is a dearth of small friendly restaurants on the eastern side of Paseo del Prado. This fits the bill in every way: bright yet intimate, the menu (in Spanish and English) is on the short side but comprehensive with a good choice of fish dishes. We booked through the website as space is limited. Food quality is high - well cooked and presented with good sized portions: we were conscious of a pride in the way our meal was prepared and served. The short wine list made for an easy choice, and wine is available by the glass. The sharing of dishes is not a problem, and positively encouraged when appetites are limited. One small downside is that vegetarian choice was not very much in evidence. Highly recommended if you are looking for a relaxed and informal setting, with cooking that demonstrates creative touches and leaves you very satisfied, all at a very acceptable price.

review_preview: The Spanish Farm proved to be one of the best places where I dined during a recent trip to Madrid. It has everything going for it -- high quality food, a lovely ambiance, terrific staff and a location near both the Prado Museum and the...
review_full: The Spanish Farm proved to be one of the best places where I dined during a recent trip to Madrid. It has everything going for it -- high quality food, a lovely ambiance, terrific staff and a location near both the Prado Museum and the Royal Botanical Gardens. I ducked out of the Prado to come here for lunch and it took me less than three minutes on foot along the street at the back of the museum.  I was greeted by a man who spoke excellent English and appeared to be the owner of the restaurant. He made me feel incredibly welcome throughout my stay and even adjusted the air conditioning when he noticed how wilted I was when I entered from the outside heat and humidity. As no one was dining then (1:30 p.m.), he allowed me to pick any table that I wanted.  The Iberic salad (13 E) that I chose came nicely presented and included tasty Spanish ham and seasonal fruit. In summer, this was delicious pomegranate. The portion was huge but still manageable. I enjoyed attentive service by an extremely pleasant woman. I highly recommend The Spanish Farm to those who want a lunch break when visiting the Prado. The museum ticket allows leaving and returning throughout the day, but get a hand stamped before departure. I found my experience here to be so enjoyable that on my next visit to Madrid, I plan to return for dinner.

title_review: The best dessert of my life!
review_preview: We came here because of good reviews and it has lived up to recommendations.  It is a tiny, modern place and it was full of Brits when we arrived at 3pm (reserve a table) but by 4 pm we were with spanish clientele. The waiter...
review_full: We came here because of good reviews and it has lived up to recommendations. It is a tiny, modern place and it was full of Brits when we arrived at 3pm (reserve a table) but by 4 pm we were with spanish clientele. The waiter was excellent and guided us skilfully through the menus advising on unknown wines and bringing three bottles to sample before we made a choice. He also dissuaded us from ordering too much and we had an excellent and filling meal by sharing a plate of anchovies followed by salmorejo for my husband and tiny beans and jamon for me. That left room for a dessert and am I glad! I was restricted in choice because I am gluten intolerant. I went for the berry soup with coconut ice cream and had to spend the next five minutes with eyes closed as the experience was so magical. The best dessert of my life - and I am 73!!!!
